unnormalised: ## My Ears Are Dancing, My Wallet Is Crying: A Hilarious Take on Music Streaming
normalised: My Ears Are Dancing, My Wallet Is Crying: A Hilarious Take on Music Streaming

unnormalised: Okay, let’s be real. Remember back in the day, painstakingly downloading songs from sketchy websites, risking a computer virus worse than a Delhi belly after roadside golgappe? Good riddance to those days! Now we have music streaming, a veritable Bollywood movie of audio joy right at our fingertips.
normalised: Okay, let’s be real. Remember back in the day, painstakingly downloading songs from sketchy websites, risking a computer virus worse than a Delhi belly after roadside golgappe? Good riddance to those days! Now we have music streaming, a veritable Bollywood movie of audio joy right at our fingertips.

unnormalised: But is it all sunshine and roses, or is there a villain lurking in the background, plotting to drain our bank accounts faster than you can say "Dhoom machale?" Let's dive in, shall we?
normalised: But is it all sunshine and roses, or is there a villain lurking in the background, plotting to drain our bank accounts faster than you can say "Dhoom machale?" Let's dive in, shall we?

unnormalised: First, the sheer *convenience*! I can listen to Diljit Dosanjh while stuck in a traffic jam near AIIMS, then switch to a relaxing sitar raga when I finally get home (two hours later, thanks Delhi traffic!). No more carrying around a million CDs (remember those?) or constantly running out of storage on my phone. Hallelujah!
normalised: First, the sheer convenience! I can listen to Diljit Dosanjh while stuck in a traffic jam near A I I M S, then switch to a relaxing sitar raga when I finally get home (two hours later, thanks Delhi traffic!). No more carrying around a million C D s (remember those?) or constantly running out of storage on my phone. Hallelujah!

unnormalised: However, the dark side whispers. Those monthly subscription fees add up, yaar! Five different streaming services, each promising exclusive content? My wallet weeps louder than Amrish Puri in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge when Simran leaves with Raj. Seriously, are they trying to bankrupt us one banger at a time?
normalised: However, the dark side whispers. Those monthly subscription fees add up, yaar! Five different streaming services, each promising exclusive content? My wallet weeps louder than Amrish Puri in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge when Simran leaves with Raj. Seriously, are they trying to bankrupt us one banger at a time?

unnormalised: And then there's the algorithm. Oh, the algorithm! It thinks I want to listen to Honey Singh remixes 24/7 just because I listened to one song ironically at my cousin's wedding. Beta, you're missing out! I also enjoy classical music, ghazals, and the occasional bit of polka. Broaden your horizons, algorithm!
normalised: And then there's the algorithm. Oh, the algorithm! It thinks I want to listen to Honey Singh remixes twenty four seven just because I listened to one song ironically at my cousin's wedding. Beta, you're missing out! I also enjoy classical music, ghazals, and the occasional bit of polka. Broaden your horizons, algorithm!

unnormalised: But let's face it, despite the financial sting and the algorithm's questionable taste, music streaming is here to stay. It's too darn convenient. I can discover new artists, re-live old favorites, and pretend I’m a sophisticated music connoisseur, all for the low, low price of my sanity (and my bank balance). So, crank up the volume and dance your heart out! Just maybe, check your bank statement afterwards. You've been warned.
